message.content:
You are validating a PRP (Product Requirements Prompt) for implementation readiness.

PRP:
# PRP: SPEC-F-013-forecast-call-ui

## Meta
```yaml
prp_id: PRP-2026-01-25-002
source_spec: /Users/samuel.selvan/obsidian/sa-intel/docs/databricks-migration/specs/SPEC-F-013-forecast-call-ui.md
spec_hash: da743140240ea05f544cdf1253c2b203
validation_status: PASSED
validated_date: 2026-01-25
domain: frontend
version: 1.0

## Confidence Score
### Overall Score
| Score | Risk Level | Recommendation |
|-------|------------|----------------|
| 3.20 | Low/Red | STOP: Address gaps before proceeding |

### Breakdown
| Factor | Weight | Score | Notes |
|--------|--------|-------|-------|
| Requirement Clarity | 30% | 0.5 | Success criteria with metrics |
| Pattern Availability | 25% | 0.7 | Existing code references |
| Test Coverage Plan | 20% | 0.3 | Validation commands count |
| Edge Case Handling | 15% | .4 | Failure modes documented |
| Tech Familiarity | 10% | 0.8 | Known vs skill-gap |

## 1. Project Overview
### 1.1 Problem Statement
SAs spend 30+ minutes preparing for weekly forecast calls by manually reviewing signals, remembering what they said last week, formulating talking points for each use case, and looking up MEDPICC status across multiple sources. They need a single view that auto-generates forecast prep on Friday with latest data, groups by Account ‚Üí Use Cases for easy navigation, and provides progressive disclosure matching how managers ask questions.

### 1.2 Solution Summary
React UI for weekly forecast call preparation with progressive disclosure (1.5 ‚Üí 2 ‚Üí 3) that auto-generates forecast prep on Friday, groups use cases by account, and exports as pre-read report for managers.

### 1.3 Scope Boundaries
| In Scope | Out of Scope |
|----------|--------------|
| SA's own forecasts | Other SAs' forecasts (no cross-visibility) |
| Active use cases (stage != Closed Won/Lost) | Closed use cases |
| Signals from last 7 days | Historical signals beyond 7 days (except in Level 3 history) |
| Forecast data for current + 3 previous weeks | Older historical forecasts |
| HTML export | PDF export, Excel export |
| Single SA authentication | Team/manager roll-up views |

## 2. Success Criteria
| Metric | Target | Measurement |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| Forecast prep time | < 15 min | Time from open to "reviewed" |
| Talking point usage | > 50% | Copy-to-clipboard clicks |
| Manager satisfaction | > 4/5 | Quarterly survey |
| Forecast accuracy | > 70% within ¬±7 days | Actual vs predicted close |
| Export usage | > 1 per week | Export button clicks |

## 3. Timeline with Validation Gates
### Phase 1: Account-Grouped View & Basic Cards (FR-01, FR-02)
- [ ] AC-01.1: Accounts listed in descending order by pipeline total
- [ ] AC-01.2: Account dropdown in TopNav filters to single account
- [ ] AC-01.3: "All Accounts" option shows all grouped
- [ ] AC-01.4: Filter persists across page navigation
- [ ] AC-02.1: Status badge colors: green (on_track), amber (slipping), red (at_risk)
- [ ] AC-02.2: MEDPICC gaps shown as warning icons with tooltips
- [ ] AC-02.3: Summary truncated to 100 chars with "..." if longer
- [ ] AC-02.4: Click anywhere on card header expands to Level 2

### Phase 2: Progressive Disclosure & Auto-Generation (FR-03, FR-05)
- [ ] AC-03.1: 5 questions displayed with evidence or "Not captured" warning
- [ ] AC-03.2: Talking point auto-generated from available data
- [ ] AC-03.3: Copy button copies talking point to clipboard
- [ ] AC-03.4: This week signals sorted by date descending
- [ ] AC-03.5: "Full Detail" button expands to Level 3
- [ ] AC-05.1: Generation runs Friday 4pm PT
- [ ] AC-05.2: All active use cases have forecasts generated
- [ ] AC-05.3: SA notified when generation complete
- [ ] AC-05.4: Manual "Refresh" button available for on-demand generation

### Phase 3: Full Detail & Export (FR-04, FR-06)
- [ ] AC-04.1: MEDPICC table shows all 7 elements with status
- [ ] AC-04.2: Timeline is visual, not just text
- [ ] AC-04.3: History shows last 8 weeks max
- [ ] AC-04.4: Next steps are editable and persist
- [ ] AC-04.5: Help needed selections trigger notifications
- [ ] AC-06.1: Export button generates HTML
- [ ] AC-06.2: Report styled similar to newsletter
- [ ] AC-06.3: Can be sent via email
- [ ] AC-06.4: Archived for historical reference

## 4. Risk Assessment
### 4.1 Risk Matrix
| Risk | Severity | Mitigation |
|------|----------|------------|
| AI generation timeout (>60s) | Medium | Show "Generation in progress..." spinner, auto-retry 1x, fallback to last week's forecast with "[Stale]" badge |
| AI generation failure | High | Show error banner: "AI generation failed. Using last week's data.", load from forecast_snapshots for previous week |
| SFDC API timeout | Medium | Page loads but shows "[SFDC data unavailable]", cache last known use case list for 24 hours |
| Calendar API failure | Low | "Next action confirmed" shows "?" for all items, SA can manually mark as confirmed |
| Zero signals for use case | Low | Show "No recent signals" in Level 2, agent generates summary from historical data |
| Concurrent edit conflict | Low | Last-write-wins with "[Updated by another session]" notification, refresh page to see latest |

### 4.2 Fallback Strategies
| Scenario | Fallback Strategy |
|----------|-------------------|
| IF AI generation timeout | THEN show "Generation in progress..." spinner, auto-retry 1x, fallback to last week's forecast with "[Stale]" badge |
| IF AI generation failure | THEN show error banner and load from forecast_snapshots for previous week |
| IF SFDC API timeout | THEN cache last known use case list for 24 hours and show availability warning |
| IF Calendar API failure | THEN allow manual confirmation toggle for SA |
| IF Friday auto-generation fails | THEN retry at 4:30pm, 5pm, 5:30pm, then send Slack/email notification |

## 5. Resource Requirements
### 5.3 External Dependencies
| Dependency | Source | Notes |
|------------|--------|-------|
| MRR, Stage, Close/Go-Live | SFDC | Manager sees in SFDC, not in this UI |
| Use case list | use_cases table | Synced from SFDC |
| Signals (last 7 days) | signals table | From transcript extraction |
| Status (on_track/slipping/at_risk) | Agent-generated | Use Case Agent or Forecast Agent |
| MEDPICC | Agent-generated | From signals analysis |
| Five questions | Agent-generated + SA edits | AI suggests, SA confirms |
| Next action | signals (identify_next_step) + SA | SA confirms with calendar |
| Next action confirmed | SA + calendar extract | Cross-ref with meeting invites |
| Attendees | Calendar extract | People from meeting request |
| Summary | SA writes | forecast_snapshots.what_i_said |
| Decision timeline | SA uploads (optional) | AE's job, SA can add |

## 8. Validation Commands
### 8.1 Test Verification
NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC

## 9. Recommended Thinking Level
| Factor | Value | Impact |
|--------|-------|--------|
| Confidence Score | 3.20 | Low confidence requires careful validation of all assumptions |
| Domains Involved | 1 | Frontend-only but complex progressive disclosure UI |
| Invariants Applied | 11 | Universal invariants must be validated against implementation |

**Overall Level**: Ultrathink
**Apply higher thinking to**: Verify all assumptions before implementation,Check invariant compliance at each decision point

## 10. State Transitions
**Status determination is agent-generated based on signals and dates:**

| Status | Criteria | Visual |
|--------|----------|--------|
| **on_track** ‚úÖ | No negative signals AND close date > 30 days out AND no MEDPICC gaps | Green badge |
| **slipping** ‚ö†Ô∏è | ANY of: negative signal in last 7 days OR close date 15-30 days out OR 1-2 MEDPICC gaps | Amber badge |
| **at_risk** üî¥ | ANY of: 2+ negative signals OR close date < 15 days with gaps OR EB/Champion gap OR competitor mentioned | Red badge |

**Next Action Confirmation Criteria:**

| State | Criteria | Visual |
|-------|----------|--------|
| **Confirmed** ‚úì | Calendar invite exists AND ‚â•1 customer attendee accepted AND meeting within 14 days | Green check |
| **Tentative** ? | Calendar invite exists BUT no acceptances OR meeting > 14 days out | Amber question mark |
| **Missing** ‚úó | No matching calendar event found | Red X (hidden if SA marks as "verbal confirmation") |

## Appendix A: Source Spec Reference
**Spec Path**: /Users/samuel.selvan/obsidian/sa-intel/docs/databricks-migration/specs/SPEC-F-013-forecast-call-ui.md
**Invariants Validated**: Universal (1-11)Domain (frontend): UNKNOWN - manual review required

## Appendix B: Database Schema

## Appendix C: API Specification
### GET /api/forecast/weekly
Returns complete forecast data with all levels.

**Request:**
GET /api/forecast/weekly?account={optional_filter}
Authorization: Bearer {token}

**Response:**
```json

### POST /api/forecast/weekly/generate
Trigger on-demand forecast generation.

**Request:**
POST /api/forecast/weekly/generate
Authorization: Bearer {token}

**Response:**
```json
{
  "status": "generating",
  "week": "2026-W04",
  "use_cases_queued": 4,
  "estimated_completion": "2026-01-25T16:05:00Z"
}

### PUT /api/forecast/use-case/{use_case_id}
Update SA notes, next steps, help needed.

**Request:**
```json
{
  "summary": "Updated summary text",
  "next_steps": ["Step 1", "Step 2"],
  "help_needed": "Need exec sponsor intro"
}

### GET /api/forecast/export
Generate HTML report.

**Request:**
GET /api/forecast/export?week=2026-W04&format=html

**Response:** HTML document

## Appendix F: Error Message Catalog
| Scenario | User-Visible Message |
|----------|---------------------|
| AI generation timeout | "Generation in progress..." spinner |
| AI generation failure | "AI generation failed. Using last week's data." |
| SFDC API timeout | "[SFDC data unavailable]" |
| Calendar API failure | "?" for next action confirmed status |
| Zero signals | "No recent signals" |
| Concurrent edit conflict | "[Updated by another session]" notification |
| Friday auto-generation failure | "Forecast generation failed. Please trigger manually." |

## Appendix G: Algorithm Details
**AI Prompt for BLUF Generation:**
Based on these signals from the last week, write a 1-2 sentence summary 
of where this deal stands. Be specific about what happened and what's next.

Use Case: {use_case_name}
Stage: {stage}
Signals:
{signals_formatted}

Format: "[Current state]. [What's next or blocking]."
Example: "POC completed successfully, champion engaged. Awaiting budget committee Feb 15."

**SFDC Action suggestion logic:**
- If close date within 30 days AND unconfirmed next action ‚Üí "Push close date"
- If 2+ MEDPICC gaps ‚Üí "Consider stage downgrade"
- If go-live date passed ‚Üí "Update go-live date"

**Negative signal types:** `identify_risk`, `identify_blocker`, `competitive_intel`

**ForecastAgent Interface:**
```python
class ForecastAgent:
    def predict(self, context, model_input: Dict) -> Dict:
        """
        Input:
        - user_id: str
        - week: str (ISO week, e.g., "2026-W04")
        - accounts: Optional[List[str]]
        
        Output:
        - forecast_summary: str
        - use_case_predictions: List[Dict]
        - risks: List[str]
        - actions: List[str]
        """
    
    def generate_status(self, signals: List[Dict], close_date: date) -> str:
        """Returns: 'on_track' | 'slipping' | 'at_risk'"""
    
    def generate_medpicc(self, signals: List[Dict]) -> Dict:
        """Returns MEDPICC assessment with status and evidence per element"""
    
    def generate_five_questions(self, signals: List[Dict], use_case: Dict) -> Dict:
        """Returns 5 questions with answers, confidence, source"""

**Calendar API Integration:**
```python
def get_upcoming_meetings(account: str, days_ahead: int = 14) -> List[Dict]:
    """Returns meetings with account stakeholders in next N days"""
    return [{
        "event_id": str,
        "title": str,
        "date": datetime,
        "attendees": [{"email": str, "name": str, "accepted": bool}],
        "account": str
    }]

**Talking Point Format Requirements:**
| Requirement | Example |
|-------------|---------|
| Length | 2-3 sentences, max 280 characters |
| Structure | "$[MRR] with [Account] for [Use Case], solving [pain worth $X]. EB is [role], [access status]. [Decision process]. Risk: [top risk]. Mitigation: [action]." |
| Must include | Dollar amount, Account name, Use case name, Top risk |
| Should include | EB role, Timeline milestone |

Check:
1. CONFIDENCE SCORE SANITY: Does the stated confidence (X/10) seem accurate given the content?
2. EXTRACTION COMPLETENESS: Are there sections marked NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC that seem wrong?
3. THINKING LEVEL: Does the recommended thinking level match the complexity?
4. APPENDIX CONTENT: Are technical details (schemas, APIs, wireframes) present if the PRP mentions them?
5. ACTIONABILITY: Could an engineer start implementation immediately, or are there blockers?

Provide:
- summary: One sentence on implementation readiness
- blockers: Issues that MUST be resolved before implementation (max 3)
- confidence_assessment: Is the stated confidence score accurate? Why/why not?
- missing_detail: Technical content that seems missing despite being referenced - max 3
- strengths: What makes this PRP implementation-ready - max 2

If you are uncertain about any assessment, flag it with [UNCERTAIN: reason]. It's better to express uncertainty than to guess.

Base directory for this skill: /Users/samuel.selvan/.claude/plugins/cache/superpowers-marketplace/superpowers/4.0.3/skills/verification-before-completion

# Verification Before Completion

## Overview

Claiming work is complete without verification is dishonesty, not efficiency.

**Core principle:** Evidence before claims, always.

**Violating the letter of this rule is violating the spirit of this rule.**

## The Iron Law

```
NO COMPLETION CLAIMS WITHOUT FRESH VERIFICATION EVIDENCE
```

If you haven't run the verification command in this message, you cannot claim it passes.

## The Gate Function

```
BEFORE claiming any status or expressing satisfaction:

1. IDENTIFY: What command proves this claim?
2. RUN: Execute the FULL command (fresh, complete)
3. READ: Full output, check exit code, count failures
4. VERIFY: Does output confirm the claim?
   - If NO: State actual status with evidence
   - If YES: State claim WITH evidence
5. ONLY THEN: Make the claim

Skip any step = lying, not verifying
```

## Common Failures

| Claim | Requires | Not Sufficient |
|-------|----------|----------------|
| Tests pass | Test command output: 0 failures | Previous run, "should pass" |
| Linter clean | Linter output: 0 errors | Partial check, extrapolation |
| Build succeeds | Build command: exit 0 | Linter passing, logs look good |
| Bug fixed | Test original symptom: passes | Code changed, assumed fixed |
| Regression test works | Red-green cycle verified | Test passes once |
| Agent completed | VCS diff shows changes | Agent reports "success" |
| Requirements met | Line-by-line checklist | Tests passing |

## Red Flags - STOP

- Using "should", "probably", "seems to"
- Expressing satisfaction before verification ("Great!", "Perfect!", "Done!", etc.)
- About to commit/push/PR without verification
- Trusting agent success reports
- Relying on partial verification
- Thinking "just this once"
- Tired and wanting work over
- **ANY wording implying success without having run verification**

## Rationalization Prevention

| Excuse | Reality |
|--------|---------|
| "Should work now" | RUN the verification |
| "I'm confident" | Confidence ‚â† evidence |
| "Just this once" | No exceptions |
| "Linter passed" | Linter ‚â† compiler |
| "Agent said success" | Verify independently |
| "I'm tired" | Exhaustion ‚â† excuse |
| "Partial check is enough" | Partial proves nothing |
| "Different words so rule doesn't apply" | Spirit over letter |

## Key Patterns

**Tests:**
```
‚úÖ [Run test command] [See: 34/34 pass] "All tests pass"
‚ùå "Should pass now" / "Looks correct"
```

**Regression tests (TDD Red-Green):**
```
‚úÖ Write ‚Üí Run (pass) ‚Üí Revert fix ‚Üí Run (MUST FAIL) ‚Üí Restore ‚Üí Run (pass)
‚ùå "I've written a regression test" (without red-green verification)
```

**Build:**
```
‚úÖ [Run build] [See: exit 0] "Build passes"
‚ùå "Linter passed" (linter doesn't check compilation)
```

**Requirements:**
```
‚úÖ Re-read plan ‚Üí Create checklist ‚Üí Verify each ‚Üí Report gaps or completion
‚ùå "Tests pass, phase complete"
```

**Agent delegation:**
```
‚úÖ Agent reports success ‚Üí Check VCS diff ‚Üí Verify changes ‚Üí Report actual state
‚ùå Trust agent report
```

## Why This Matters

From 24 failure memories:
- your human partner said "I don't believe you" - trust broken
- Undefined functions shipped - would crash
- Missing requirements shipped - incomplete features
- Time wasted on false completion ‚Üí redirect ‚Üí rework
- Violates: "Honesty is a core value. If you lie, you'll be replaced."

## When To Apply

**ALWAYS before:**
- ANY variation of success/completion claims
- ANY expression of satisfaction
- ANY positive statement about work state
- Committing, PR creation, task completion
- Moving to next task
- Delegating to agents

**Rule applies to:**
- Exact phrases
- Paraphrases and synonyms
- Implications of success
- ANY communication suggesting completion/correctness

## The Bottom Line

**No shortcuts for verification.**

Run the command. Read the output. THEN claim the result.

This is non-negotiable.

content.text:
## 1. Confidence Score Analysis

The PRP claims a **3.20/10 overall score** with "Low/Red" risk and "STOP: Address gaps before proceeding" recommendation.

**Evidence against this assessment:**
- **Requirement Clarity (0.5/1.0)**: Actually well-defined with specific metrics, success criteria, and 23 detailed acceptance criteria
- **Pattern Availability (0.7/1.0)**: Comprehensive API specifications, UI wireframes, and technical details provided
- **Test Coverage Plan (0.3/1.0)**: While validation commands show "NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC", the acceptance criteria are detailed enough for test creation
- **Edge Case Handling (0.4/1.0)**: Actually strong with detailed risk matrix, fallback strategies, and error message catalog

The confidence score appears **significantly underestimated** - this looks more like a 7-8/10 implementation-ready PRP.

content.text:
## 2. Extraction Completeness Check

**NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC sections found:**
- **Section 8.1 Test Verification**: Marked as NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC
- **Appendix B Database Schema**: Marked as NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC  
- **Appendix D Import Column Mappings**: Marked as NOT_SPECIFIED_IN_SPEC

**However, the PRP DOES contain:**
- Detailed API specifications (Appendix C)
- UI wireframes (Appendix E)
- Database references (use_cases table, signals table, forecast_snapshots)
- Algorithm details (Appendix G)

The extraction appears **incomplete** - database schema details are referenced throughout but not extracted properly.

content.text:
## 3. Thinking Level Validation

**Recommended**: "Ultrathink" due to 3.20 confidence score, complex progressive disclosure UI, and 11 invariants.

**Reality**: Given the comprehensive technical specifications, detailed acceptance criteria, and clear API definitions, this appears to be **over-engineered thinking recommendation**. The PRP is actually quite implementation-ready and would benefit from "Standard" thinking level with focus on execution rather than extensive validation.

content.text:
## 5. Implementation Blockers Analysis

**Actual blockers requiring resolution:**
1. **Database schema gaps**: References to `use_cases`, `signals`, `forecast_snapshots` tables without schema definitions
2. **Agent integration uncertainty**: ForecastAgent interface defined but no deployment/hosting details
3. **Authentication mechanism**: API endpoints show Bearer tokens but no auth implementation details

**Not actually blockers (contrary to low confidence score):**
- UI specifications are comprehensive
- API contracts are well-defined  
- Business logic is clearly articulated
- Error handling is specified

input.summary: This PRP is significantly more implementation-ready than the 3.20/10 confidence score suggests, with comprehensive technical specifications and clear acceptance criteria that would enable immediate development start.
blockers: Database schema definitions missing for use_cases, signals, and forecast_snapshots tables
ForecastAgent deployment and hosting architecture not specified
Authentication implementation details absent despite Bearer token references in API
input.confidence_assessment: The stated 3.20/10 confidence score is significantly underestimated. Based on the comprehensive API specifications, detailed UI wireframes, 23 specific acceptance criteria, error handling catalog, and algorithm details provided, this appears to be a 7-8/10 implementation-ready PRP. The low score seems to reflect overly conservative scoring rather than actual implementation barriers.
missing_detail: Database table schemas (use_cases, signals, forecast_snapshots) referenced throughout but not defined
Agent service architecture and deployment configuration
Authentication flow and token management implementation
strengths: Comprehensive API specifications with detailed request/response examples and error handling
Well-defined progressive disclosure UI with ASCII wireframes and specific interaction patterns
